title: The cream of the slop: this year's AI highlights
description:
2025 has proved that artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping online reality and that the “slop” is here to stay. NPR’s Geoff Brumfiel and Shannon Bond have spent much of the year rolling around in that slop and join host Scott Detrow to break down some of the highlights and how to sort the real from the fake.For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.
Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
This episode was produced by Elena Burnett and Daniel Ofman.
It was edited by Brett Neely, John Ketchum and Courtney Dorning.
Our executive producer is Sami Yenigun.
content:
2025 has proved that artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping online reality and that the “slop” is here to stay.

title: Trump’s artificial intelligence order gets bipartisan pushback in Ohio
description: Ohio lawmakers oppose the Ohio Trump AI order that undermines state authority on artificial intelligence regulations.
content:
State Sen. Louis Blessing III (R-Colerain Township) and Rep. Christine Cockley (D-Columbus) introduced a resolution condemning the executive order they say limits states’ rights.
In a statement, Blessing called it unconstitutional and insulting.

title: School says it gets better grades with AI instruction than teachers
description: When thinking of jobs artificial intelligence could be replacing, that of teaching is probably not at the top of the list.
content:
SAN FRANCISCO (KGO) – When thinking of jobs artificial intelligence could be replacing, teaching is probably not at the top of the list.

title: Congress Revisits Export Curbs in Wake of Trump’s H200 Approval
description: House Republicans are calling for arms-sale style congressional oversight of artificial intelligence chip exports as the Trump administration moves to approve licenses for Nvidia Corp. to ship its H200 processor to China.
content:

title: Microsoft, Constellation Energy restart Three Mile Island nuclear reactor
description: Microsoft and Constellation Energy partner to restart Three Mile Island nuclear reactor with $1 billion federal loan to power artificial intelligence operations.
content:
Microsoft and Constellation Energy are teaming up to restart the long-dormant Three Mile Island nuclear reactor in Pennsylvania.
The companies are backed by a $1 billion federal energy loan, part of what Constellation CEO Joe Dominguez calls a nuclea... [3151 chars]

title: AI boom drives data-center dealmaking to record high, says report
description: Global data-center dealmaking surged to a record high through November this year, driven by an insatiable demand for computing infrastructure to meet the boom in artificial intelligence usage.
content:
Dec 19 (Reuters) - Global data-center dealmaking surged to a record high through November this year, driven by an insatiable demand for computing infrastructure to meet the boom in artificial intelligence usage.
